chain_of_thought_reasoning: To answer the question, I need to find the user who received the highest bounty amount under the vote type of 8. This can be done by first filtering the votes table to include only those with VoteTypeId 8. Next, I'll select the maximum bounty amount from this filtered result. After identifying the highest bounty amount, I'll join the votes table with the users table to get the DisplayName and WebsiteUrl of the user associated with this bounty. Hence, my SQL query will need to get the required fields from the users table and only include the user who has the maximum bounty amount from the votes.
SQL: SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 AND V.BountyAmount = (SELECT MAX(BountyAmount) FROM votes WHERE VoteTypeId = 8);

sql_generation.Question: Under the vote type of 8, provide the display names and websites URLs of the user who got the highest bounty amount.
sql_generation.Evidence: vote type of 8 refers to VoteTypeId = 8; the highest bounty amount refers to MAX(BountyAmount);
sql_generation.pred_sql: SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 AND V.BountyAmount = (SELECT MAX(BountyAmount) FROM votes WHERE VoteTypeId = 8);
sql_generation.gold_sql: SELECT DisplayName, WebsiteUrl FROM users WHERE Id = ( SELECT UserId FROM votes WHERE VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1 )
